# Tender Announcement for Installation of Barbed Wire at Archambault Medium Institution

## Tender Number and Identification

* **Reference Number**: CB-551-10546486
* **Amendment Number**: 4
* **Solicitation Number**: 21301-24-4659222
* **Publication Date**: March 5, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date**: April 25, 2024, 2:00 PM EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: May 1, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date**: June 28, 2024

## Project Description and Objectives

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a general contractor to install barbed wire on the existing fence at the Archambault Medium institution in Sainte-Anne-des-Plaines. The project aims to secure the interior courtyards of the institution by preventing climbing on the facade up to the roof.

## Requirements and Deliverables

* The contractor must supply all necessary labor, equipment, and materials to complete the work.
* The deliverables include:
	+ Installing concertina-type barbed wire on existing fences.
	+ Modifying sections of fences to increase their height.
	+ Adding concertina-type barbed wire to sections of existing walls.

## Procurement and Evaluation

* Tendering procedures: Competitive bidding is being used, and all interested suppliers are invited to submit a bid.
* Evaluation criteria: Lowest price, compliant bid.
* Commodity code: 30121718 and 72120000 (Safety fence and net for rock drop and Nonresidential building construction services).

## Contact Information and Procurement Assistance

* **Contracting Authority**: Karine Clément, Contracting and Procurement Regional Officer, (514) 235-8177, Karine.Clement@csc-scc.gc.ca.
* **Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC)**: offers seminars on selling goods and services to the Government of Canada. Details can be found on the Buyandsell.gc.ca website.

## Notes and Attachments

* A mandatory site visit is required (see detailed bid solicitation document).
* Interested suppliers can download the solicitation document and associated documents from Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders.
* The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).
